p: Process‐based disturbance modules for wind and bark beetles (specifically Ips typographus L., Coleoptera: Curculionidae), the two most important disturbance agents in Austria (Thom et al. 2013), were used to represent the natural disturbance regime in the simulations (Seidl et al. 2014a, Seidl and Rammer 2017). Disturbances were simulated dynamically and spatially explicitly, taking into account agent‐specific susceptibilities (such as forest structure and edge effects for wind, and host tree availability and defense for bark beetles) as well as climate conditions (peak wind speeds, temperatures influencing beetle development). Bark beetle population dynamics and spread were simulated explicitly in space and time.
